citeinfo.title: The StreamCat Dataset: Accumulated Attributes for NHDPlusV2 (Version 2.1) Catchments for the Conterminous United States: State Soil Geographic Database (STATSGO)

pubinfo.publish: US EPA Office of Research & Development (ORD) - National Health and Environmental Effects Research Laboratory (NHEERL)

descript.abstract:
This dataset (STATSGO_Set1 and STATSGO_Set2) represents the soil characteristics within individual, local NHDPlusV2 catchments and upstream, contributing watersheds based on the STATSGO dataset (see Data Sources for links to NHDPlusV2 data and STATSGO data). Attributes were calculated for every local NHDPlusV2 catchment and accumulated to provide watershed-level metrics.
This data set is derived from the STATSGO landscape rasters for the conterminous USA. Individual rasters (Landscape Layers) of organic material (om), permeability (perm), water table depth (wtdep), depth to bedrock (rckdep), percent clay (clay), and percent sand (sand) were used to calculate soil characteristics for each NHDPlusV2 catchment.
The soil characteristics were summarized to produce local catchment-level and watershed-level metrics as a continuous data type (see Data Structure and Attribute Information for a description). The STATSGO data are distributed in two sets, STATSGO_Set1 and STATSGO_Set2, based on common NoData locations in each set of soil GIS layers (see ftp://newftp.epa.gov/EPADataCommons/ORD/NHDPlusLandscapeAttributes/StreamCat/Documentation/ReadMe.html).
descript.purpose: These data were created in support of the US EPAâ€™s National Aquatic Resource Survey (NARS) and Safe and Sustainable Waters Resources (SSWR) Programs. However, these watershed summaries of landscape data have broad applicability for hydrological, geomorphic, or ecological modelling, management, and restoration. For details on EPA NARS and SSWR Programs see http://water.epa.gov/type/watersheds/monitoring/aquaticsurvey_index.cfm and http://www.epa.gov/research/progressreport/water.htm
descript.supplinf:
STATSGO was split into Set_1 and Set_2 based on the no data values that exist in the rasters across each of the landscape layers. (See ReadMe file)
All code and scripts used to produce these data were written in the python or R programming languages and are freely available at: ftp://newftp.epa.gov/EPADataCommons/ORD/NHDPlusLandscapeAttributes/StreamCat/Documentation/Code/
WtDep - Seasonal water table depth of soils (cm). Om - Organic matter content of soils (% by weight). Perm - Permeability of soils (inches/hour). RckDep - Depth to bedrock of soils (cm). Clay - Clay content of soils (%). Sand - Sand content of soils (%).
Glossary of Terms
Stream Segment: NHD line describing a section of contiguous stream or river between upstream and downstream tributaries (as depicted in USGS topographic quadrangles), except where the segment is a headwater or terminal stream (e.g., an outlet to the ocean).
Catchment (Cat): The portion of the landscape where surface flow drains directly to an NHD stream segment, excluding any upstream contributions.
Watershed (Ws): The set of hydrologically-connected catchments, consisting of all upstream catchments that contribute flow to any local catchment.
COMID: Unique identifier for each stream segment, and associated catchment, in NHDPlusV2. Watershed metrics describe entire area of all catchments that accumulate to the specific catchment based on the NHD PlusFlow table.
Riparian Buffer (Rp100): Spatial buffer of 100-m that was added to NHDPlusV2 stream network and NLCD water pixels. The buffers were used to spatially constrain calculations for some landscape metrics to within 100 meters of the riparian area.
Landscape Layer: Any geospatial layer from which we derived statistical summaries for both local catchments and watersheds. These landscape layers were comprised of several GIS formats, including vector (points, lines, or polygons) and raster.

idinfo.useconst: None. procstep.procdesc: Dataset downloaded from internal FTP provided by James Falcone of USGS. Data source, date, units and resolution were recorded in a project tracking spreadsheet and verified. ftp://newftp.epa.gov/EPADataCommons/ORD/NHDPlusLandscapeAttributes/StreamCat/Documentation/DataDictionary.html
Projection of dataset verified as USGS Albers Equal Area Conic and projected if necessary

Performed a visual inspection of dataset for gaps, edges other anomalous features. Verified how no-data values were represented and recoded values as no-data where appropriate (for instance, if no-data locations represented by 0's or -9999, these were converted to no-data values).

Ran zonal statistics python script (StreamCat.py) to calculate zonal statistics for all NHDPlusV2 catchments in each NHDPlusV2 Vector Processing Unit (VPU). Zonal statistics were perofrmed using either ZonalStatisticsAsTable, TabulateArea, or spatially joining vector point data to catchments. Each method applies to the type of landscape layer being evaluated, Continuous, Categorical, or Point. We also calculated the percent of each catchment that had coverage by a given landscape layer (i.e. was not null). These results are accumulated using the NHDPlusV2 flow table to summarize upstream catchment values and complete watershed values for the metric.

Clean and standardize results of zonal statistics table from accumulation script / process (makeFinalTables.py). Clean up consisted of calculating mean value of metric per zone, renaming and sorting zonal statistics fields, and writing zonal results to .csv file.

enttyp.enttypd: STATSGO soil characteristics evaluated at the local catchment and watershed levels.

attr.attrdef: Unique ID label to each catchment in NHDPlusV2
Area of local catchment measured in square kilometers.
% of the catchment that is covered by the landscape raster.
Area of the local catchment and accumulated upstream catchments composing the entire watershed (Ws) measured in square kilometers.
% of the watershed that is covered by the landscape raster.
Clay content of soils (%). Mean of all clay values within the local catchment (Cat)
Sand content of soils (%). Mean of all sand values within the local catchment (Cat)
Clay content of soils (%). Mean of all clay values within the total upstream watershed (Ws).
Sand content of soils (%). Mean of all sand values within the total upstream watershed (Ws).

enttyp.enttypd: STATSGO soil characteristics evaluated at the local catchment and watershed levels.

attr.attrdef: Unique ID label to each catchment in NHDPlusV2
Area of local catchment measured in square kilometers.
% of the catchment that is covered by the landscape raster.
Area of the local catchment and accumulated upstream catchments composing the entire watershed (Ws) measured in square kilometers.
% of the watershed that is covered by the landscape raster.
Organic matter content (% by weight) of soils. Mean of all om values within the local catchment (Cat)
Depth to bedrock of soils (cm). Mean of all rckdep values within the local catchment (Cat)
Seasonal water table depth of soils (cm). Mean of all wtdep values within the local catchment (Cat)
Permeability of soils (inches/hour). Mean of all perm values within the local catchment (Cat)
Organic matter content (% by weight) of soils. Mean of all om values within the total upstream watershed (Ws).
Depth to bedrock of soils (cm). Mean of all rckdep values within the total upstream watershed (Ws).
Seasonal water table depth of soils (cm). Mean of all wtdep values within the total upstream watershed (Ws).
Permeability of soils (inches/hour). Mean of all perm values within the total upstream watershed (Ws).

overview.eaover: Each of the attributes listed describe the STATSGO soil characteristics by catchment (Cat) or watershed (Ws). STATSGO_Set1 contains data for Clay and Sand. STATSGO_Set2 contains data for Om, Perm, RckDep, and WtDep. The difference between the two exists to clarify the description of NO DATA cells throughout the data sets in table distribution. (See Additional Notes here ftp://newftp.epa.gov/EPADataCommons/ORD/NHDPlusLandscapeAttributes/StreamCat/Documentation/ReadMe.html)
